text: ⓘ From 2019 and earlier, PHO/1 papers contained Multiple Choice Questions (MCQs) in Section A, rather than Short Answer Questions (SAQs).
ⓘ These are not available to the public, so this paper only contains Section B (Essays).
Section B contains essay questions and carries 50% of the total marks for the examination.
You have 3 hours (plus any pre-agreed individual adjustment) to answer this paper. You must complete this paper within this time-period.

sub-instructions: ⓘ Answer TWO of the following essay questions, with a maximum of one from questions B1a and B1b.
content: What are the strategies that animals use to survive fluctuations in temperature?
Contrast the processes which control cell expansion leading to growth in plants, fungi and microbes.
Discuss how organisms can use symbiotic relationships in order to gain nutrients.
What are the fundamental principles that govern fluid movement within organisms?
Compare and contrast the mechanisms used by plants and animals to sense the dark/light cycle.
Compare and contrast plant growth regulators with endocrine control in animal systems, and in doing so, consider how plants manage without a central nervous system.
